meanings.definition: A type of soil rich in humus and typically found in grasslands.
meanings.sent1: The farmer planted his crops in the rendzina soil to ensure they would grow well.
meanings.sent2: The rendzina in the grasslands provided nutrients for the plants to thrive.
meanings.sent3: The worms in the rendzina soil had a party, munching on all the organic goodies.
meanings.sent4: The rendzina soil was like a buffet for the hungry plants, offering them a feast of nutrients.
meanings.sent5: The dark, rich rendzina soil cradled the seeds, promising a bountiful harvest.

meanings.definition: The dark, fertile layer of soil formed from the decomposition of organic matter.
meanings.sent1: The gardener admired the rendzina layer for its ability to nurture the plants.
meanings.sent2: After composting, the organic matter transformed into nutrient-rich rendzina.
meanings.sent3: The rendzina soil whispered secrets of the past lives of the decomposed matter.
meanings.sent4: The rendzina layer was a treasure trove of nutrients waiting to be discovered by the roots.
meanings.sent5: The earthworms danced in the rendzina, celebrating the cycle of life and decay.
